Exploring-MysticBBS.title: Exploring MysticBBS
Exploring-MysticBBS.content:
Exploring MysticBBS: A Nostalgic Dive into BBS Software
Introduction
Mystic BBS revives the charm of MS-DOS Bulletin Board Systems (BBS) for modern and vintage tech enthusiasts alike. This software bridges the gap between the simplicity of text-based communication and the complexity of today‚Äôs social media platforms. My journey began with a quest to rediscover the roots of online communication, from the firsthand use of a BBS to setting one up. Let‚Äôs explore what makes Mystic BBS stand out in an era dominated by graphical user interfaces and why it‚Äôs still relevant (or not) for users today.
Key Features
Mystic BBS distinguishes itself with features that are a breath of fresh air in today‚Äôs ad-driven internet landscape:

Pure Text Experience: Embrace the clarity and simplicity of plain text.
Privacy-Focused: No bots, trackers, or intrusive analytics.
Ad-Free Environment: Enjoy content without distractions.

Setup and Configuration
Getting Mystic BBS up and running on an Ubuntu LXC container was straightforward. The process, detailed on their installation guide, involved downloading the package, following simple instructions, and configuring firewall rules. My goal was to dive into the BBS experience with minimal fuss, focusing on the essence of communication over customization, so this review will not go into detail on this.
Performance
Mystic BBS is impressively lightweight, capable of running on anything from a modern server to a vintage 486 laptop. This flexibility demonstrates its efficiency and the low barrier to entry in terms of hardware requirements.
Software and User Experience
The true test came with posting a message. Despite the simplicity of text-based interaction, the challenge lies in introducing contemporary users to Telnet or SSH‚Äîtechnologies far removed from today‚Äôs intuitive graphical interfaces. The process, while straightforward to the tech-savvy, poses a significant hurdle to less technical users, underscoring a gap between the ease of use and accessibility.
Pros and Cons
Pros:

Free and Open Source.
Simple setup with minimal hardware requirements.
Privacy-focused and ad-free.

Cons:

Not user-friendly for those unfamiliar with command-line interfaces or older technologies.

Conclusion and Rating
MysticBBS stands as a testament to the enduring appeal of BBS systems, offering a niche platform for enthusiasts of retro computing and privacy-conscious users. While it excels in simplicity and privacy, its accessibility barriers limit its appeal to a broader audience. MysticBBS is a niche haven for the tech-savvy elite, reminiscent of communities like Arch Linux and DWM users. For the general public, however, its complexities make it less recommendable.
Rating: üåüüåü (2/5 Stars)
For its targeted audience, MysticBBS is unparalleled; for the mainstream, it remains a curiosity.

Forgiving-Sin.title: Forgiving Sin
Forgiving-Sin.content:
John 20:21-23 (KJV)
21 Then said Jesus to them again,  Peace be unto you: as my Father hath sent me, even so send I you.
22 And when he had said this, he breathed on them, and saith unto them,  Receive ye the Holy Ghost:
23 Whose soever sins ye remit, they are remitted unto them; and whose soever sins ye retain, they are retained.

Obsidian.title: Obsidian
Obsidian.content:
Around 2005 or 2006 I discovered org-mode for emacs . I was my sole reason for moving from Vim to emacs. For the last approximately 19 years I have used emacs as my daily driver for note taking. It took me a solid month to get comfortable using emacs. As anyone who has used it will tell you there is a huge learning curve. However once you ‚Äúget it‚Äù you end up wanting to use it for nearly everything.
I used Org-Mode to organize my thoughts. I used emacs to send and receive email. That only lasted for a day or two. I have used it on and off for calendering, playing mp3‚Äôs, listening to Shoutcast streams, RoamNotes, and as an RSS reader and web browser. Oh, and yes I used it as my IDE.
That is until I found Obsidian
I found Obsidian to be the best note taking application I have come across. The follow the philosophy of ‚Äúfuture proof your work‚Äù. What does that mean? Just like my beloved emacs, they use plain text files. Your notes although they will be displayed and entered in a beautiful manner, are nothing more than old fashioned ASCII files. ASCII files will be able to be read for the next 10,000 years.
This website was cobbled together using Obsidian and a plugin called Quartz (see the footer for the link). This site is hosted on Github and when my changes are pushed up to Git, the site gets deployed automatically.
Obsidian used as a blog publishing platform is cool. However where it really shines is taking notes and helping to organize your thoughts. To really get an understanding of what Obsidian is check out this YouTube Playlist Obsidian for Beginners

Water-Baptism.title: Water Baptism
Water-Baptism.content:
Today Russel Brand is getting baptized. As such the world of Protestantism has plenty to say on the matter. One such comment on the matter is below.

Someone commented this on the post above:
Baptism Means nothing if He has not placed his faith in the finished work of Jesus Christ and repented of his sins. If he has, then praise God. I love Russell Brand, one of the smartest and funniest guys out there.
Friend, you have this backwards.
James 2:14:
What shall it profit, my brethren, if a man say he hath faith, but hath not works? Shall faith be able to save him?
James 2:15:
And if a brother or sister be naked and want daily food:
James 2:16:
And one of you say to them: Go in peace, be ye warmed and filled; yet give them not those things that are necessary for the body, what shall it profit?
James 2:17:
So faith also, if it have not works, is dead in itself.
If you are a Bible believing Christian like me, then you have to realize that what our friend professed to believe is not what the Bible teaches.
And then there was this comment:
Water does not wash away our sins. the blood of Jesus alone does that.
And then later this:
I am a Bible believing Christian. If you say baptism can wash away sin then why would Almighty God send his Son to die? Please. You are taking scripture out of context. The thief on the cross was not baptized. I encourage baptism but to say it is necessary for salvation takes away from what Jesus did on the cross.
Let‚Äôs take on the the first objection that water does not wash away our sins.
Two requirements - REPENT & BAPTISM
Acts 2:38:
But Peter said to them: Do (REPENT) penance: and be (BAPTISM) baptized every one of you in the name of Jesus Christ, for the remission of your sins. And you shall receive the gift of the Holy Ghost.
Acts 8:26:
Now an angel of the Lord spoke to Philip, saying: Arise, go towards the south, to the way that goeth down from Jerusalem into Gaza: this is desert.
Acts 8:27:
And rising up, he went. And behold, a man of Ethiopia, an eunuch, of great authority under Candace the queen of the Ethiopians, who had charge over all her treasures, had come to Jerusalem to adore.
Acts 8:28:
And he was returning, sitting in his chariot and reading Isaias the prophet.
Acts 8:29:
And the Spirit said to Philip: Go near and join thyself to this chariot.
Acts 8:30:
And Philip running thither, heard him reading the prophet Isaias. And he said: Thinkest thou that thou understandest what thou readest?
Acts 8:31:
Who said: And how can I, unless some man shew me? And he desired Philip that he would come up and sit with him.
Acts 8:32:
And the place of the scripture which he was reading was this: He was led as a sheep to the slaughter: and like a lamb without voice before his shearer, so openeth he not his mouth.
Acts 8:33:
In humility his judgment was taken away. His generation who shall declare, for his life shall be taken from the earth?
Acts 8:34:
And the eunuch answering Philip, said: I beseech thee, of whom doth the prophet speak this? Of himself, or of some other man?
WITNESS 1st
Phillip tells the eunuch about Christ (from the Old Testament).
Acts 8:35:
Then Philip, opening his mouth and beginning at this scripture, preached unto him Jesus.
Acts 8:36:
And as they went on their way, they came to a certain water. And the eunuch said: See, here is water: What doth hinder me from being baptized?
Asks if he believes, 2nd
Acts 8:37:
And Philip said: If thou believest with all thy heart, thou mayest. And he answering, said: I believe that Jesus Christ is the Son of God.
Water Baptism, 3rd
Acts 8:38:
And he commanded the chariot to stand still. And they went down into the water, both Philip and the eunuch. And he baptized him.
Acts 8:39:
And when they were come up out of the water, the Spirit of the Lord took away Philip: and the eunuch saw him no more. And he went on his way rejoicing.
BAPTISM WASHES AWAY SIN
Acts 22:16:
And now why tarriest thou? Rise up and be baptized and wash away thy sins, invoking his name.
Acts shows us that there is more than one thing required for salvation.

Witness and acceptance. Phillip witnesses to the eunuch. The eunuch hears and accepts.
The eunuch is Baptized.
Our sins are in fact washed away by baptism.

What did not happen?
After the eunuch believed what Phillip witnessed to him, Phillip did not say ‚ÄúWell you are saved because you believed‚Äù. He also did not say ‚ÄúStop the chariot and pray the sinners prayer with me‚Äù.
There were two works that needed to be done. He had to believe and then be baptized. And note that Phillip put a qualifier on baptism. Phillip says ‚ÄúIF you believe with all your heart‚Äù, so baptism is conditional too. It‚Äôs not good enough to say you believe, you have to do so with all your heart.
Romans 6: 3 Know you not that all we who are baptized in Christ Jesus are baptized in his death?
4 For we are buried together with him by baptism into death: that, as Christ is risen from the dead by the glory of the Father, so we also may walk in newness of life.
Take note that Paul doesn‚Äôt say, you are saved because you believe. He does however say explicitly that a work - baptism - is what causes us to have a new life.
You are positively not saved by faith alone and those espousing that are not Bible believing Christians because clearly the Bible does not teach that. Faith is a necessary requirement but is not the only requirement.
The Thief on The Cross Objection
If you are before Jesus and He forgives you, because He is God The Father, God The Son, and God The Holy Spirit, then there is nothing more needed. During the Mass we say ‚Äú‚Ä¶ Lord, I am not worthy that thou shouldst enter under my roof; but only say the word, and my servant shall be healed.‚Äù Matthew 8:8 Christ has that power, no one else. So unless you were forgiven directly by Christ, you should get baptized with water.
Mark 16:15-16
15 And he said unto them,  Go ye into all the world, and preach the gospel to every creature.
16 He that believeth and is baptized shall be saved; but he that believeth not shall be damned.

about.title: About
about.content:
My name is Norman Bauer.
I have many interests such as my wife & our kids (2 girls), outdoors stuff, canning, long term food storage, cryptocurrency, precious metals, Austrian Economics, libertarianism, agorism, the US Constitution, electronics, programming, computer repair, virtualization, Linux, Linux Containers, networking, Books, UFO‚Äôs, music, radio‚Äôs (CB, AM, Shortwave, and some HAM stuff too), King James Bible,Catholicism, Christian Apologetics, The Early Church Fathers, and a lot more. I‚Äôll likely touch on all of these and more here.
I am also a privacy advocate. I believe as the founders of the United States did, that privacy is a fundamental Right. Which is why this blog is a actually a static site instead of a WordPress or other CMS site. For the same reason you will not find Google Analytics or Facebook Pixel on this site.
Thank you for visiting.
Norm

m2.title: M2
m2.content:
The chart below is produced using the numbers from The St Louis Federal Reserve Bank. They are in charge of reporting on the money supply.
On March 16, 2020 the M2 stock was 15,726 billion USD.
As of July 27th, 2020 the M2 stock was 18286 billion USD.
That represents a 14% increase in the money supply in a matter of 4 months.

REAL INFLATION = 25.14% from 04/16/20 - 02/01/21


What is M- Stock?
In banking the supply of money and credit is broken down into three catagories.
M1

M1 includes funds that are readily accessible for spending. M1 consists  of: (1) currency outside the U.S. Treasury, Federal Reserve Banks, and  the vaults of depository institutions; (2) traveler‚Äôs checks of nonbank  issuers; (3) demand deposits; and (4) other checkable deposits (OCDs),  which consist primarily of negotiable order of withdrawal (NOW) accounts at depository institutions and credit union share draft accounts.  Seasonally adjusted M1 is calculated by summing currency, traveler‚Äôs  checks, demand deposits, and OCDs, each seasonally adjusted separately.

M2

M2 includes a broader set of financial assets held principally by  households. M2 consists of M1 plus: (1) savings deposits (which include  money market deposit accounts, or MMDAs); (2) small-denomination time  deposits (time deposits in amounts of less than $100,000); and (3)  balances in retail money market mutual funds (MMMFs). Seasonally  adjusted M2 is computed by summing savings deposits, small-denomination  time deposits, and retail MMMFs, each seasonally adjusted separately,  and adding this result to seasonally adjusted M1.

M3 - Discontinuted
From Investopidia

M3 is a measure of the money supply that includes M2 as well as large time deposits, institutional money market funds, short-term repurchase agreements and larger liquid assets. The M3 measurement includes assets that are less liquid than other  components of the money supply and are referred to as ‚Äúnear, near  money,‚Äù which are more closely related to the finances of larger  financial institutions and corporations than to those of small  businesses and individuals

M3 is no longer counted by the Federal Reserve. There are some private people who try to recreate a best guess of M3 such as John Williams from Shadow Stats. However the statistics they provide are best guess and should be viewd as a guide rather than relied upon as accurate.
Why is M2 important?
Since M2 includes the money supply from M1, it is a great indicator of just how much inflation is injected directly into the economy. Inflations is defined as an increase in the money supply. By looking at M2, we can see just how much prices for goods and services will rise.
For instance, when the Federal Reserve through its Open Markets Operations (FOMO) and Open Markets Comitte (FOMC) bailed out Wall Steet and banks, they did so by injecting money into the M3 money supply. As such asset prices for Stocks and housing, which are largely dependent on credit, rose. However because that money did not come into the M2 supply goods and services remained relativly low (4.5% increase annually)
Now is the time to pay close attention to M2. Understanding M2 will help you know where to put your money to keep it safe. Particularly if you do not have a lot of money, understaning M2 will let you know what you are going to need to buy excess of because the price of goods will increase in the future.

movies/classic-horror.title: My Classic Horror Movies List To Watch
movies/classic-horror.content:
I have been a fan of the classic horror genre for a long time. Franenstein, Dracula, and so on. Surprisngly to me I have only watched a couple of the Universal movies. What I have watched the most of is the Public Domain horror classics.
Wanting to keep a record of what I have watched and keep track of it, I thought a spreadsheet would be good. So I found a list of 100 Univerdal Horror films and did a webscrape using Python, to dump them into a CSV that I could then import into Excel and start tracking. While I was there I thought why not dump it into JSON & YAML at that same time and then I could share the list on my blog as well.
The part that I thought was going to be the easiest turned out to be the most annoying, getting the data into Hugo. I will give that it‚Äôs own post later as well as spruce this page up a bit more.
You can grab the code on my Github repository to track your own.

movies/westerns.title: My Western Movie List To Watch
movies/westerns.content:
Just like my Classic Horror Movies List Westerns are another genere that I love. I tend to like more modern Westerns like Young Guns (which is not on the list for some reason), Django Unchained, and Wyatt Earp. However there are some gems in the original Westerns so I am going to be watching them.
Going down the list I was surprised at just how many I had already watched. I guess it is one of those genres that creeps up on you if you are of certain age.
If the status is ‚ÄúAll quiet on the Western Front‚Äù I have not seen it and if it is ‚ÄúI‚Äôm your huckleberry‚Äù I have watched it.

privacy.title: Privacy
privacy.content:
From the rapid adoption of the Internet in the early 90‚Äôs all the way up to about 2012, the Internet was awesome. Not because of the technology that it ran on, but because it was free as in Libra. You were not counted, numbered, or tracked, and if you were it was out of the ordinary.
Then In-Q-Tel dropped billions of $USD into Google, Facebook, and other social media companies and the Internet became one big psyop.
I wan‚Äôt to explore the possibilities of getting back to what we once had.
Exploring MysticBBS
